thread.title: Northern Arizona campus shooting: 1 dead, suspect in custody
thread.title_full: Northern Arizona campus shooting: 1 dead, suspect in custody - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Northern Arizona campus shooting: 1 dead, suspect in custody
text:
FLAGSTAFF, AZ (RNN) - A confrontation between students led to a shooting that left one dead and three other people injured Friday on the campus of Northern Arizona University.
NAU Police Chief G.T. Fowler identified the shooting suspect as Steven Jones, an 18-year-old student at the school. He did not identify any of the victims, other than saying they were all students.
Fowler called the situation stable and said the suspect was in custody. The campus is not on lockdown, according to the school's Twitter account.
#NAUAlert : Details confirmed 4 victims, 1 fatality, 3 wounded. Shooter is in custody. Situation is stabilized. Campus not on lockdown.
â€” NAU (@NAU) October 9, 2015 The three victims were being treated at Flagstaff Medical Center, according to a statement from the university.
The first report of shots fired came at 1:20 a.m. The three wounded people were taken to Flagstaff Medical Center. An NAU spokeswoman told CNN she had not received word on the condition of the injured.
The shooting occurred in a parking lot near the Mountainview Hall dormitory on the campus.
The Flagstaff campus has more than 20,000 students enrolled. Northern Arizona University was established in 1899, has multiple campuses in the state, an online program and offers 91 undergraduate degree programs.
On Oct. 1, a gunman opened fire in a classroom at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, OR. He killed nine people and injured several others before killing himself, according to police.
